descript.abstract: Total annual precipitation estimated as an average between the GSMaP monthly rainfall and WorldClim Bioclim12 data set at 6/120 arcdegrees. GSMaP monthly rainfall data produced by Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency JAXA (http://sharaku.eorc.jaxa.jp/GSMaP_crest/) is explained in detail in: "Kubota, T., Shige, S., Hashizume, H., Aonashi, K., Takahashi, N., Seto, S., Hirose, M., Takayabu, Y. N., Nakagawa, K., Iwanami, K., Ushio, T., Kachi, M., and Okamoto, K., 2007. Global Precipitation Map using Satelliteborne Microwave Radiometers by the GSMaP Project: Production and Validation. IEEE Trans. Geosci. Remote Sens., 45(7), 2259-2275". WorldClim precipitation data (http://biogeo.berkeley.edu/worldclim1_4/grid/cur/bio_2-5m_bil.zip) is explained in detail in: "Hijmans, R.J., S.E. Cameron, J.L. Parra, P.G. Jones and A. Jarvis, 2005. Very high resolution interpolated climate surfaces for global land areas. International Journal of Climatology 25:1965-1978.".
descript.purpose: Intended use: (multipurpose) global soil mapping and monitoring, species distribution modelling, environmental modelling.
